result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:14 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Jacob J Milligan in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Jacob J Milligan.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 20CM974, 20CM977, & 22CF60.  Court notes PH has not been held on 22CF60. 1:30 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: K. Edwards, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Michelle Brekkn with Student Intern Alison Casey DF ATTY: Stephanie Schmidt for today  Defendant Jacob J Milligan in court, in custody. Includes 20CM974, 20CM977, and 22CF60. Court reviews files and questions non-appearance. DE states he's been in in-patient treatment and was picked up on warrant when he was returning home from treatment. DE states he waived extradition from MN. QUASH WARRANT. Court reinstates bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. DE states he has Court in early September in Washington County, MN. DE to contact Atty Dolfi if there's a conflict.  gll

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Dolfi. Filed by Atty Satorius. arc
Pretrial Assessment Report. sf (sealed)
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 11:30 am. Includes 22CF60, 20CM974 and 20CM977

Includes 22CF60, 20CM974 and 20CM977   

 - Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Menards in Hudson, WI and Kwik Trip in Hudson, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:29 PM   Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: S. Fox, DA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi w/K. Doppolito, DF:  Jacob J Milligan appeared from jail. Def qualifies for a PD. Includes 22CF60, 20CM974 and 20CM977. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Not Guilty pleas entered for cases 20CM974 and 20CM977.  QUASH WARRANTS. Bond arguments. Defendant waived extradition from MN and intends to go to Teen Challenge and has family support.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
